comment._content: His obit appears in the NYTimes of 3/9/14.  It describes him as being famous for his position in society, he was known as a friend to the poor and homeless and he wrote 3 books and numerous articles with his views about snobs and of obligations of the rich to the poor.  He died at the Hotel Berkely in London on March 8.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content:
Frederick Townsend Martin (b. 1849 in Albany NY; d. 1914 in London); graduated from Albany Law School; colonel in the New York National Guard; his writings included "The Passing of the Idle Rich" (1911) and "My Personal Experiences of Meeting Snobs" (1911).   His older brother Bradley Martin (1841-1913) was a prominent banker.

(from the 1919 Encyclopedia Americana)
